text: for me one of the best flavors that I
know of in a pie crust and maybe it's
just from my upbringing
there was always lard in a good pie
crust and it's it sounds people find
lard like a very icky subject it's seems
like Oh God why would you do that but it
really has no flavor when it's rendered
which means that it has melted away from
where it starts anyway I
I use the recipe and it's gonna be in
the bag that you take that is primarily
butter 90% butter and it just is has a
little bit of lard and I find that's
enough to give the crust a certain kind
of snap and that's sort of interpreted
in my mind anyway as flakiness as
opposed to something that is a little
softer when your fork goes through it so
I'm gonna show you in all its humility
what it looks like
this is leaf lard which is comes from
the hindquarters of the pig around the
kidneys it is particularly advantageous
for cooking in fact even though it does
come from around the kidneys it has no
off flavors
once you render it now you'll notice in
there there's all kinds of there's some
of the pigs still in there so what we do
to render it is I put it in a baking pan
with about a quart of water say who's
that amount they're about a quart of
water and I put it in the oven at 260
degrees so what happens is the water
gets hotter than boiling although it
just barely boils since it's in a wide
open pan and then the fat melts into the
water so it gives it a gentle kind of
melting in other words we're not frying
it we're not sauteing this this little
monster there that you have which would
brown it and we'll talk about browning
later so it just melts into the water
and then the water eventually evaporates
and you're just left with this beautiful
if I do say so myself
this beautiful substance which is
rendered leaf lard and the reason I call
it beautiful is that
it just is so silky so it's and because
this was rendered in water you see that
it's just like oh my gosh
put that on toast so anyway we all know
about fat and we're you know we're all
trying to avoid it but some fats good
you got to have a little fast
